title: How to Make a Small Bowl of Guacamole

steps.headline: With your chef knife, cut your avocados in half by cutting around the pit long ways.
steps.description: Avocados have pits, so you can't just cut right through them. Remove the pit and put parallel the perpendicular cuts into the avocado while still in the skin. The width of your cuts effect the end size of diced avocado. Then scoop out the avocado inside with your tablespoon in to your mixing bowl. After that, you can mash up your avocado as you desire with your spoon.

steps.headline: Take your 1 clove of garlic and smash with the flat of your knife.
steps.description: Sprinkle Kosher salt onto it and finely mince the garlic. Add to mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Take your 1/2 lime and squeeze and squeeze as much as you desire into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: The key will be to balance you salt level with your acid (lime juice) level.

steps.headline: Take your 1/2 tomato and remove the stem area if using the top of the tomato and remove seeds.
steps.description: (Optional use a serrated blade if your chef knife isn't sharp enough.) Slice the tomato and the dice it. Ideal size is 1 centimeter (0.4 in) pieces. Add to mixing bowl.

steps.headline: Take your 1/4 red onion and finely dice it.
Pull of as much cilantro as you like and finely chop it.
Add a dash of cumin and several pinches of Kosher salt (to taste).
Mix to desired consistency and adjust seasonings as needed.
Transfer guacamole from your mixing bowl to your serving dish (optional).

text: With your chef knife, cut your avocados in half by cutting around the pit long ways. Avocados have pits, so you can't just cut right through them. Remove the pit and put parallel the perpendicular cuts into the avocado while still in the skin. The width of your cuts effect the end size of diced avocado. Then scoop out the avocado inside with your tablespoon in to your mixing bowl. After that, you can mash up your avocado as you desire with your spoon. Take your 1 clove of garlic and smash with the flat of your knife. Sprinkle Kosher salt onto it and finely mince the garlic. Add to mixing bowl. Take your 1/2 lime and squeeze and squeeze as much as you desire into the mixing bowl. The key will be to balance you salt level with your acid (lime juice) level. Take your 1/2 tomato and remove the stem area if using the top of the tomato and remove seeds. (Optional use a serrated blade if your chef knife isn't sharp enough.) Slice the tomato and the dice it. Ideal size is 1 centimeter (0.4 in) pieces. Add to mixing bowl. Take your 1/4 red onion and finely dice it. Add to mixing bowl. Pull of as much cilantro as you like and finely chop it. Add to mixing bowl. Add a dash of cumin and several pinches of Kosher salt (to taste).  Mix to desired consistency and adjust seasonings as needed.  Transfer guacamole from your mixing bowl to your serving dish (optional).
